oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibitions; Exhibition buildings; Festivals; Fairs; Anniversaries; Amusement rides; Water slides
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of the Chute located at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition in Nashville, Tennessee.

The Chute was a water ride in which the passenger boarded a boat that slid down a steep incline and splashed into the lake below, covering onlookers with a spray of water. The attraction was located at the highest point in the park. The pool of water was only 30 inches deep. A ride on the Chute cost 10 cents.
